â
The '''GNU Image Manipulation Program''', or '''GIMP''', is a [[raster graphics editor]] used to process digital graphics and photographs. Typical uses include creating graphics and [[logo]]s, resizing and cropping photos, altering colors, combining multiple images, removing unwanted image features, and converting between different image formats.<ref>[http://docs.gimp.org/en/introduction.html GIMP User Manual. Chapter 1. Introduction]</ref> GIMP can also be used to create basic animated images in [[Graphics Interchange Format|GIF]] format. It is often used as a free software replacement for [[Adobe Photoshop]], the most widely used bitmap editor in the printing and graphics industries; however, it is not designed to be a Photoshop clone.<ref>[https://lists.xcf.berkeley.edu/lists/gimp-developer/2007-August/018486.html [Gimp-developer] mentioning Photoshop on this list<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The project's [[mascot]] is named [[Wilber (mascot)|Wilber]].
+
The '''GNU Image Manipulation Program''', or '''GIMP''', is a [[free software|free]] [[raster graphics editor]] used to process digital graphics and photographs. Typical uses include creating graphics and [[logo]]s, resizing and cropping photos, altering colors, combining multiple images, removing unwanted image features, and converting between different image formats.<ref>[http://docs.gimp.org/en/introduction.html GIMP User Manual. Chapter 1. Introduction]</ref> GIMP can also be used to create basic animated images in [[Graphics Interchange Format|GIF]] format. It is often used as a free software replacement for [[Adobe Photoshop]], the most widely used bitmap editor in the printing and graphics industries; however, it is not designed to be a Photoshop clone.<ref>[https://lists.xcf.berkeley.edu/lists/gimp-developer/2007-August/018486.html [Gimp-developer] mentioning Photoshop on this list<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The project's [[mascot]] is named [[Wilber (mascot)|Wilber]].
â
The project was started in 1995 by [[Spencer Kimball]] and [[Peter Mattis]] and is now maintained by a group of volunteers under the auspices of the [[GNU Project]].<ref name="ancient" /> Available under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License]], GIMP is [[free software]].
+
The project was started in 1995 by [[Spencer Kimball]] and [[Peter Mattis]] and is now maintained by a group of volunteers under the auspices of the [[GNU Project]].<ref name="ancient" />
